intro: Rosa sempervirens subvar. leiostyla, commonly known as the evergreen玫瑰 or the evergreen rose, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and dark green, leathery foliage that remains evergreen throughout the year. The plant produces fragrant, semi-double to double pink flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its persistent foliage and long-lasting blooms.
